page.title: 06Dores/Abriachan_Bomber
page.content: The {Wellington Bomber}crashed in 1940 with engine failure North West of Aldourie Pier.It came down left wing first.The plane was designed by{Sir {Barnes Wallis.}The Bomber has twin Rolls Royce Merlin engines.The Bomber is hopefully to be raised in September.Plans for the barge are being made.The{Wellington Association} have raised {Â£20,000}to finance the salvage.The Bomber lies in{70 metres} of water near Lochend.British Aluminium have donated material for the lifting frame.A diving firm in Yarmouth are providing equipment and services free of charge.A complete photographic and video record has been taken of the Bomber.There were 4,000 Wellington Bombers made in world war 2.When the Bomber is raised it is hoped that it will be preserved.
